div.l: Wel was the wenche / that with hym myghte meete
At euery bridale / wolde he synge and hoppe
He loued bet the Tauerne / than the shoppe
For / whan ther any ridyng was in Chepe
Out of the shoppe / thider wolde he lepe
Til that he hadde / al the sighte yseyn
And daunced wel / he wolde noght come ageyn
And gadred hym / a meynee of his sort
To hoppe and synge / and maken swich disport
With Rechneuer and recheles þis lesson he lerys
With waste and with wranglere his owne pley ferys
With lytghthonde and with lykorouse mowth with vnschamfast
With drynke more ⁊ with drawe a bak her thryst is y past
With malaperte ⁊ with mysseavysed suche meyny þey hight
That wolle do but a lytul tylle her dyuer bedyght
And ther / they setten steuene / for to meete
To pleyen at the dees / in swich a Streete
For in the town / nas ther no Prentys
That fairer / koude caste a paire of dys
Than Perkyn koude / and ther to he was free
Of his dispense / in place of pryuetee
With Magot ⁊ with Mylsent whan þat he mette
The bagge with þe powder anon was vnknette
His purs was inperfit he couthe notwelle kepe
Yet let vs be mery while oure sire is aslepe
With Pyes ⁊ with Pykrels with wyues moste swete
With loche ⁊ with lamprey þe childe myght not ete
The Tapster þe Taverner þe koke was nedy
Wolde clepe on perkyn for his purs was so redy
That foond his maister wel / in his chaffar
